H0.text: The level of carbon dioxide in the blood is what the brain monitors to control the rate of breathing during normal activities.

H1.text: The level of carbon dioxide in the cells is what the brain monitors to control the rate of breathing during normal activities.

H2.text: The level of carbon dioxide in the lungs is what the brain monitors to control the rate of breathing during normal activities.

H3.text: The level of carbon dioxide in the air is what the brain monitors to control the rate of breathing during normal activities.

A4.text: blood CO2 is the primary parameter for biological regulation of respiration because its concentration is inversely related to pulmonary ventilation

A5.text: the chemoreceptors are far more responsive to blood CO2 concentration changes than to H+ concentration changes
